title: Discosorus
text:
Discosorus, a genus of the <a href="Discosorida">Discosorida</a> and member of the family <a href="Discosoridae">Discosoridae</a>. Not to be confused with "<a href="Discoceras">Discoceras</a>". "Discosorus" consists of rapidly expanding endogastric brevicones, mostly known from isolated <a href="siphuncle">siphuncle</a>s composed of broadly expanded segments that increase rapidly in size. Septal necks are recumbent, connecting rings thin, bullettes small. The siphuncle interior is occupied by endocones produced by layered annular deposits expanded back toward the apex, leaving a central tube running down the middle. The short phragmocone is poorly known.
"Discosorus" is found in the Middle <a href="Silurian">Silurian</a> of eastern and arctic North America and as part of the Discosoratidae is derived from the <a href="Lowoceratidae">Lowoceratidae</a> which forms a link in the <a href="Llandovery%20epoch">Early Silurian</a> from the Late <a href="Ordovician">Ordovician</a> exogastric "<a href="Faberoceras">Faberoceras</a>" of the <a href="Westonoceratidae">Westonoceratidae</a>.
